result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Earl Miller Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
4:04 PM Case called. Defendant Richard Earl Miller in court.  Probation Officer, Jordan Koeras in court. Court sets record. Ms Koeras addresses court. Requests imposing 60 day sanction, with a stay, allowing Dept of Probation to have imposed if DE has not started probation conditions by March 2018. Court addresses DE, Mr Miller. DE addresses court. 
Court imposes sanction of 60 days in county jail, stayed, with conditions:  completion of AODA assessment and Anger Management assessment,  1/2 of current obligation to be paid. Conditions to be completed by March 2018.
Probation Officer, Ms Koeras to file order.
Probation review hearing on October 25, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

Notice from DOC that DOC still has custody of this case.
Extension received on discharged case.
Request for Probation Review Hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Earl Miller in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 97.  2:15 PM   Court calls case and recites appearances.
State moved to amend counts in 14 CF 97 ct 1 misd. battery add count 2 disorderly conduct class B misd.  would plead to both counts and 15 CF 61 would be dismissed and used as read-in.  90 days jail on DC / costs $579.00 and count 1 9 month co. jail stayed  - probation 2 years - 30 days co. jail - aoda - anger managment and any follow thru - no contact with BHM dob:5/28/98 - fine $768.00 including costs - consecutive to count 2.
Atty Hoffman and defendant agree.  
Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.   Atty's stipulate to probable cause portion of complaint.  Court grants motion to amend 14 CF 97 - count 1 to misd. battery 940.19(1)  adding count 2 misd. disorderly conduct 947.01(1)
Defendant entered plea of nc to counts 1 and 2 in 14 CF 97.  Court finds defendant guilty.   State argues sentencing.  Atty Hoffman argues sentencing.  Court questions the atty's re: probation.  Atty Hoffman makes stmt requests he report to jail the end of august.  Court will only allow him not to report to jail until august is if 15 CF 61 remains open.  Atty Hoffman makes stmt requests 15 CF 61 be reopened until he reports to jail on 14 CF 97.  Defendant does not wish to address the court.  Court questions the defendant.

COURT:  Count 1:  Imposed/stayed 9 months county jail with huber consecutive to sentence in count 2 - sentenced to 2 years probation - 30 days county jail consecutive to count 2 with huber - AODA within 30 days of release of custody - Anger Management  and any follow thru - no contact with B.H.M. date of birth 5/28/98 and no contact with A.J.M.  dob 6/1/01 - fine $768.00 including costs - any conditions DOC may impose.  bond to be forwarded to DOC to be applied to court obligations.

Count 2:  90 days county jail with huber to begin on/before 8/28/15 by 3:00 PM credit for 4 time served - costs of $579.00

15 CF 61 bail amended to no contact with AjM 6/1/01 and BHM 5/28/98 and no contact with their residence and remains open
   to be dismissed once reports to jail bond to be forwarded to DOC to be applied to fines in 14 CF 97

Defendant Richard Earl Miller in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Richard Earl Miller in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Michael Hoffman moves to withdraw as counsel.  DEF states he is trying to find private counsel but has not yet been able to do so.  DEF has an issue with the representation of Atty Hoffman and requests the withdrawal.  Court reschedules jury trial in order to ensure fairness and due process.  Court takes Motion to Withdraw under advisement, Atty Hoffman not released until DEF has new counsel.  Jury trial rescheduled for 7-16-15.  Scheduling conference set for May 12, 2015 @ 10:00 am.  New counsel may appear by phone at this scheduling conference if necessary.
